data.title: The 60+ Best Movies Set in Montana
data.meta_description: Over 60 filmgoers have voted on the 60+ Best Movies Set in Montana. Current Top 3: A River Runs Through It, Legends of the Fall, The Revenant
data.text:
Ranked By

467 votes

67 voters

Voting Rules

Regardless of where the movie was filmed, it must be set in Montana. Vote up the best movies with Montana as the backdrop.

Which of these movies about Montana are the best? It's time to vote up the best movies set in the Treasure State. Some of these movies were actually filmed in Montana but all of them are about or partially set in Montana. Nestled between Idaho and North Dakota, Montana is the inspiration or setting for classic movies and cult favorites. From Lonesome Dove to Arrival, it's time to finally determine the greatest Montana movies.

Other good movies set in Montana include Open Range, The Horse Whisperer, and Legends of the Fall. You will also find Brad Pitt, Robert Duval, Robert Redford in multiple movies on this list. Look for more of your favorite actors in the list before and be sure to vote.

Vote up the best movies based in Montana. Be sure to check back to see what other voters think about these Montana films. Don't see your favorite Montana movie? Add it to the list and find out how other film aficionados rank your additions.

Latest additions: Mending the Line, Outlaw Posse

Over 60 Ranker voters have come together to rank this list of The 60+ Best Movies Set in Montana

Released : 1992

Directed by : Robert Redford

Set against the breathtaking backdrop of Montana's Big Sky Country, A River Runs Through It showcases the state's natural beauty and idyllic rivers in a way few films have been able to capture. Directed by Robert Redford and based on Norman Maclean's autobiographical novella, the movie delves into the spiritual bond between two brothers and their passion for fly fishing. The poignant storytelling and stunning cinematography featuring the Blackfoot River make this film an iconic ode to Montana.

Released : 1994

Directed by : Edward Zwick

Legends of the Fall, an epic historical romance, takes viewers on an emotional journey through the lives of three brothers and their father in early 20th-century Montana. The sweeping landscape shots and detailed portrayal of ranch life highlight the ruggedness and serenity of the Treasure State. Starring Brad Pitt and Anthony Hopkins, the movie's powerful performances complement its awe-inspiring backdrops, solidifying Legends of the Fall as a classic Montana masterpiece.

Robert Duvall, Kevin Costner, Annette Bening

Released : 2003

Directed by : Kevin Costner

In Open Range, director and star Kevin Costner transports audiences to the vast, dramatic landscape of Montana at the end of the open range era. The film tells the story of free-grazing cattle drivers who defend their way of life against corrupt ranchers in Montana's picturesque frontier. Featuring dazzling vistas and an authentic depiction of Old West life, Open Range leaves an indelible mark on the cinematic legacy of Montana.

Leonardo DiCaprio, Tom Hardy, Domhnall Gleeson

Released : 2015

Directed by : Alejandro González Iñárritu

The Revenant, inspired by the true story of fur trapper Hugh Glass, delivers a visceral portrayal of survival, revenge, and resilience in Montana's untamed wilderness. Director Alejandro González Iñárritu captures the rugged beauty of Montana's snowy mountains, dense forests, and icy rivers, creating a visually stunning and immersive experience. With Leonardo DiCaprio's gripping performance and the raw, unforgiving landscapes, The Revenant stands as a testament to the state's wild, untamed spirit.

Robert Redford, Kristin Scott Thomas, Sam Neill

Released : 1998

Directed by : Robert Redford

Adapted from Nicholas Evans' novel, The Horse Whisperer tells the story of a horse trainer tasked with healing an injured girl and her horse after a tragic accident. Set in the breathtaking Montana wilderness, the movie showcases the bond between humans and nature, while highlighting the state's legendary horse culture. Directed by and starring Robert Redford, The Horse Whisperer's emotional narrative and picturesque scenery make it a standout portrayal of Montana's spirit.

Amy Adams, Jeremy Renner, Forest Whitaker

Released : 2016

Directed by : Denis Villeneuve

Arrival, the critically acclaimed sci-fi drama, takes place in a secluded Montana valley where mysterious alien crafts have landed. The film's portrayal of Montana's vast and isolated geography serves as the perfect setting for a tense, otherworldly first contact scenario. With its intelligent plot and Academy Award-nominated cinematography, Arrival proves that even within the science fiction genre, Montana's striking landscapes can leave a lasting impact.
